channel.title: GECOM on The Guyana Brief
channel.description: Recent content in GECOM on The Guyana Brief

item.title: Tuesday Brief: Ali Collects Medal in Brazil While Budget Debate Wreckage Still Smouldering
item.description:
Your Tuesday rundown from all four papers. Grab your coffee, this one’s spicy.

ðŸ… Ali Gets Medal, Country Gets More Promises

President Ali popped across to Boa Vista on Monday and came back wearing the Medalha Forte SÃ£o Joaquim â€” Roraima’s highest honour â€” presented by Governor Antonio Denarium. The Chronicle gave it the full red-carpet treatment, naturally.

Ali talked about “removing barriers to trade, improving connectivity, and creating an enabling environment for private-sector engagement” with Brazil. You know, all the things we’ve been talking about since approximately 1966.

item.title: Uncle Ramesh Take: Dey Giving de Man Medal and All-You Still Complaining?
item.description:
Uncle Ramesh read de papers from Brooklyn dis morning and he got PLENTY to say.

Eh-eh! So de President gone Brazil, get de highest honour from Roraima state, talk about trade and food security and energy cooperation â€” and all-you STILL finding fault? De man building bridges â€” LITERAL bridges â€” between two countries and de opposition side chatting bout “we heard this before.”

You know what I hearing from Lethem side? People EXCITED. Brazilian business people coming over, Guyanese going across. Dat is REAL economic activity, not paper talk. When last time de opposition build a relationship with ANYBODY? Dey can’t even get along with deyself, much less a whole country.
